intro: Diplazium queenslandicum, commonly known as the Queensland serrate shield fern, is a member of the family Blechnaceae. It is a terrestrial fern that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests and understoreys. The plant has a creeping rhizome with erect, lanceolate fronds that are serrated along the edges. Its sporangia are clustered in sori on the underside of the fronds, typical of ferns. Diplazium queenslandicum is native to eastern Australia and is often found in humid, tropical climates.
